raw_text:
Man Utd stroll to Cup win
 
 Wayne Rooney made a winning return to Everton as Manchester United cruised into the FA Cup quarter-finals.
 
 Rooney received a hostile reception, but goals in each half from Quinton Fortune and Cristiano Ronaldo silenced the jeers at Goodison Park. Fortune headed home after 23 minutes before Ronaldo scored when Nigel Martyn parried Paul Scholes' free-kick. Marcus Bent missed Everton's best chance when Roy Carroll, who was later struck by a missile, saved at his feet.
 
 Rooney's return was always going to be a potential flashpoint, and he was involved in an angry exchange with a spectator even before kick-off. And Rooney's every touch was met with a deafening chorus of jeers from the crowd that once idolised the 19-year-old. Everton started brightly and Fortune needed to be alert to scramble away a header from Bent near the goal-line. But that was the cue for United to take complete control with a supreme passing display on a Goodison Park pitch that was cutting up. Fortune gave United the lead after 23 minutes, rising to meet Ronaldo's cross from eight yards after the Portuguese youngster had been allowed too much time and space by the hapless Gary Naysmith. United dominated without creating too many clear-cut chances, and they almost paid the price for not making the most of their domination two minutes before half-time. Mikel Arteta played a superb ball into the area but Bent, played onside by Gabriel Heintze, hesitated and Carroll plunged at his fee to save. United almost doubled their lead after 48 minutes when Ronaldo's low drive from 25 yards took a deflection off Tony Hibbert, but Martyn dived to save brilliantly. And Martyn came to Everton's rescue three minutes later when Rooney's big moment almost arrived as he raced clean through, but once again the veteran keeper was in outstanding form. But there was nothing Martyn could do when United doubled their lead after 57 minutes as they doubled their advantage. Scholes' free-kick took a deflection, and Martyn could only parry the ball out for Ronaldo, who reacted first to score easily. Everton's problems worsened when James McFadden limped off with an injury. And there may be further trouble ahead for Everton after goalkeeper Carroll required treatment after he was struck on the head by a missile thrown from behind the goal. Rooney's desperate search for a goal on his return to Everton was halted again by Martyn in injury-time when he outpaced Stubbs, but once again Martyn denied the England striker.
 
 - Manchester United coach Sir Alex Ferguson: "It was a fantastic performance by us. In fairness I think Everton have missed a couple of players and got some young players out. "The boy Ronaldo is a fantastic player. He's persistent and never gives in. "I don't know how many fouls he had He gets up and wants the ball again, he's truly a fabulous player." Everton: Martyn, Hibbert, Yobo, Stubbs, Naysmith, Osman, Carsley, Arteta, Kilbane, McFadden, Bent. Subs: Wright, Pistone, Weir, Plessis, Vaughan. Manchester United: Carroll, Gary Neville, Brown, Ferdinand, Heinze, Ronaldo, Phil Neville, Keane, Scholes, Fortune, Rooney. Subs: Howard, Giggs, Smith, Miller, Spector. Referee: R Styles (Hampshire)
llama3.2:1b: Manchester United won 2-0 against Everton in the FA Cup quarter-finals with goals from Quinton Fortune and Cristiano Ronaldo in each half. Wayne Rooney returned to Manchester United after a hostile reception, which was met with jeers from the crowd that idolized him. The match was dominated by United, who had few clear-cut chances despite struggling to create scoring opportunities. Everton's problems worsened when two of their players were injured, and goalkeeper Roy Carroll required treatment after being hit on the head by a missile thrown behind the goal. Rooney scored twice in injury-time to seal the win for Manchester United.
llama3.2:3b: Man Utd beat Everton 2-0 in the FA Cup quarter-finals with goals from Quinton Fortune and Cristiano Ronaldo. Wayne Rooney made a winning return to Goodison Park but was booed by the crowd. Gary Naysmith allowed too much space for Ronaldo, who scored after 23 minutes. United dominated despite limited clear-cut chances, with Martyn saving several key shots.
gemma2:2b:
Manchester United defeated Everton 3-0 in the FA Cup quarter-finals to advance to the next round. Wayne Rooney had a mixed return to Goodison Park as he was jeered throughout the match but still provided key moments with goals and chances created for his team.  Everton had their fair share of chances, especially Marcus Bent's missed opportunity before halftime. 
Despite Everton's strong start, United controlled the game and ultimately emerged victorious thanks to a combination of good passing, Ronaldo’s finishing, and some unfortunate errors from Everton’s goalkeeper.
qwen2.5:0.5b:
### Summary:

Manchester United comfortably defeated Everton in the FA Cup quarter-finals with Wayne Rooney’s return and a superb display from his team mates, led by Marcus Bent who saved well against Arsenal's Roy Carroll. The away side struggled to create clear-cut chances but held on until the end to secure victory for the home side.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Manchester United defeats Everton 2-0 in the FA Cup quarter-finals, with Ronaldo scoring both goals after returning to Goodison Park.
qwen2.5:3b: Wayne Rooney's return to Everton saw Manchester United cruise to a comfortable victory in the FA Cup quarter-finals, defeating Everton 2-0. Quinton Fortune and Cristiano Ronaldo scored for United within each half, with Everton's Marcus Bent missing the best chance. Although Rooney faced jeers from fans at Goodison Park, his return was largely met with support from Ferguson. Everton struggled without key players, particularly those who had been injured or suspended. Martyn was particularly effective in preventing a comeback attempt by Manchester United.
opencoder:1.5b: Manchester United coach Sir Alex Ferguson: "It was a fantastic performance by us. In fairness I think Everton have missed a couple of players and got some young players out. The boy Ronaldo is a fantastic player. He's persistent and never gives in. I don't know how many fouls he had He gets up and wants the ball again, he's truly a fabulous player. Everton: Martyn, Hibbert, Yobo, Stubbs, Naysmith, Osman, Carsley, Arteta, Kilbane, McFadden, Bent. Subs: Wright, Pistone, Weir, Plessis, Vaughan. Manchester United: Carroll, Gary Neville, Brown, Ferdinand, Heinze, Ronald.."
smollm:1.7b:
The summary should be concise and to the point, preserving key ideas and details while omitting unnecessary information. The goal is to provide a brief overview of the main points in the text without losing its essence or tone. Here's an example of how you could summarize the given text:

"Wayne Rooney made a winning return to Everton as Manchester United cruised into the FA Cup quarter-finals."
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Alright, I need to summarize this football article in a concise way. Let's see the key points.

The story is about Wayne Rooney returning to Everton and Manchester United winning the FA Cup quarter-final. He received some criticism from fans but scored his first goal since he joined. The goals came from Fortune and Ronaldo after a series of headers. Everton struggled with the pressure, especially from Martyn, who saved multiple chances. United dominated without creating many chances, leading to almost a draw but with two late goals by Ronaldo.

So, I should include the main events: Rooney's return, his role as a flashpoint, goals scored, Everton's strategy, and the consequences for Everton. Also, list the key players involved and their stats briefly.

Wayne Rooney returned to Everton to help Manchester United advance in the FA Cup quarter-finals. He received criticism but scored his first goal since joining the club. Goals came from Quinton Fortune and Cristiano Ronaldo, who scored after a series of headers. Everton struggled with pressure from Martyn, who saved multiple chances, leading to almost a draw but with two late goals by Ronaldo. Key players include Manchester United coach Sir Alex Ferguson, substitutes, and both teams' players.
tinyllama:1.1b: Manchester United secured a place in the quarter-finals of the FA Cup with a dominating 4-1 victory over Everton, led by their star player, Wayne Rooney. The match was marked by tensions and aggression, with Rooney subjected to a raucous reception from some fans and violent chants aimed at the opposing player, Cristiano Ronaldo. Nevertheless, United's impressive passing display and decisive goals in each half kept them on track for victory, while their star player scored his first goal of the season in an inspiring performance. Despite a late injury to goalkeeper Carroll, the match ended on a positive note for United, with Rooney having been a highlight of their dominating performance.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Manchester United progressed to the quarter-finals of the FA Cup with a 2-0 win over Everton at Goodison Park. Wayne Rooney was on the receiving end of jeers from the home crowd, but he managed to find the target twice, with goals in each half from Quinton Fortune and Cristiano Ronaldo. United's impressive passing display saw them dominate the pitch and take control of the game. The match ended 2-0 after extra time and a penalty shootout was required for a winner. Marcus Bent, Roy Carroll, and Paul Scholes were all sent off before the final whistle. Manchester United will now face either Southampton or West Brom in the semi-finals.
phi:2.7b: In today's FA Cup game between Manchester United and Everton, Wayne Rooney made a great comeback and scored two goals as his team cruised into the quarter-finals. Although he received hostile reception from the Everton crowd, his performances were outstanding with both Fortune and Ronaldo scoring against them. Martyn was also playing outstandingly for Everton but couldn't deny Manchester United's domination. However, they almost doubled their lead when Tony Hibbert saved a low drive by Mikel Arteta at half-time. Rooney had a great opportunity to score in the second half but Martyn came to his rescue and prevented it. Carroll was later injured as well, leaving Everton with even more problems ahead.
orca-mini:3b: Manchester United cruised into the FA Cup quarter-finals with a 2-0 win over Everton at Goodison Park. Wayne Rooney made a winning return to Everton as Manchester United scored twice through Quinton Fortune and Cristiano Ronaldo. The match started off with a hostile reception for Rooney, who was booed by the Everton fans. However, he played well and even scored a goal. Marcus Bent missed Everton's best chance when Roy Carroll saved at his feet.
hermes3:3b: Manchester Utd win FA Cup quarter-final against Everton, with Rooney returning and scoring against his former team.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Manchester United advanced to the FA Cup quarter-finals after a comfortable win against Everton, with Wayne Rooney making a triumphant return but receiving jeers from the Goodison Park crowd. Quinton Fortune and Cristiano Ronaldo scored goals in each half, silencing the booing fans. Although Everton had moments of bright play, United dominated the match with their superior passing display. The match saw several notable saves by Everton goalkeeper Nigel Martyn, but ultimately Manchester United secured a well-deserved victory.
stablelm2:1.6b: Manchester United easily won the FA Cup quarter-final against Everton with goals from Quinton Fortune and Cristiano Ronaldo in a dominant performance. Wayne Rooney made a winning return for Everton after being jeered by the crowd. Despite an early Everton push, Manchester United took control of the match with superb passing and doubled their lead before halftime through a Ronaldo finish. James McFadden was injured for Everton, while goalkeeper Roy Carroll required treatment after being hit by a missile from behind the goal.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Manchester United secured a comfortable 2-0 victory over Everton in the FA Cup quarter-finals at Goodison Park. Despite Wayne Rooney's hostile reception, he remained an integral part of the team and almost scored early on but was denied by goalkeeper Roy Carroll. United took the lead in the 23rd minute when Quinton Fortune headed home from a cross by Cristiano Ronaldo. Everton's Marcus Bent had their best chance, which was saved by Carroll. United doubled their lead in the 57th minute after Ronaldo capitalized on a parry of his free-kick by Martyn. Rooney, returning to his former club, missed several chances but was consistently denied by Martyn and Everton's defense. The match saw an incident where Carroll was struck by a missile, and James McFadden limped off with an injury. Manager Sir Alex Ferguson praised Ronaldo's persistence and exceptional skill.
chatgpt-4o-latest: Manchester United secured a comfortable FA Cup quarter-final spot with a 2-0 win over Everton at Goodison Park. Wayne Rooney faced a hostile reception on his return but played a key role as Quinton Fortune and Cristiano Ronaldo scored in each half. Fortune headed in Ronaldo's cross after 23 minutes, and Ronaldo capitalized on a rebound from Paul Scholes' deflected free-kick in the 57th minute. Everton's Marcus Bent missed their best chance, while United dominated possession. Goalkeeper Roy Carroll was struck by a missile from the crowd, adding to Everton's woes. Sir Alex Ferguson praised Ronaldo's persistence and United's overall performance.
